condition.description: The `condition` argument is an expression that must use the value of the variable to return `true` if the value is valid or `false` if it is invalid. The expression can refer only to the variable that the condition applies to, and _must not_ produce errors.

error_message.description: If `condition` evaluates to `false`, an error message including the sentences given in `error_message` will be produced. The error message string should be at least one full sentence explaining the constraint that failed, using a sentence structure similar to the above examples.
